children.value: Welcome to the Key Member dashboard! Here you can find access to Members Only content like our Proud Member: Ring of Keys badges to use on your website, resumé, or portfolio.

content.content:
Click to download your Ring of Keys badge for both web (optimized to use on your website or digital resume) and print (optimized to be printed at 1.5” square on your paper resume or print materials).

For Web For Print

The last Sunday of every month at 7pm EST, the Ring of Keys Leadership Team meets to discuss the ongoing events and discuss ways to advocate for our community. This Office Hour is an open space for any and all Keys to participate. 

Zoom link for all meetings:  https://us02web.zoom.us/j/87456562879

    Upcoming meetings:

    Sunday September 26th, 7pm ESt

    Sunday October 31st, 7pm EST

    Sunday November 28th, 7pm EST

    Sunday December 26th, 7pm EST

content.blockTitle: Submit Your Work for a Social Media Plug
content.content:
Submit news on an upcoming job to have featured on the Ring of Keys social platforms at our Key Member News Submission Portal.

Submit News

Use our Casting Letter to submit to theatre organizations to help advocate for authentic representation and queer the stage.

Go to Google Docs

Stay up to date with our Exclusive Key Monthly Workshop Series and Monthly Meetups by visiting our News page.

Go to RoK News

Provide any feedback to make Ring of Keys a safer and more inclusive space.

Go to Feedback Form

Aggregated Comments Sheet

There was a request from Keys to aggregate the questions and issues raised into one spreadsheet. In addition, we used this sheet to answer the anonymous questions asked via the Town Hall Google Form.
Email info@ringofkeys.org if you have any feedback, questions, or concerns!

The TGNC Keys Committee is a group of Keys volunteering to serve as a direct line of communication between the Keys community and Ring of Keys. Want to connect with the Committee? Reach out to them through this Form.

Committee Members:

Lindz Amer  (they/them)
Lily Ali-Oshatz (she/her)
K Paley (they/them)
Sophie Sagan-Gutherz (they/them)

Connect with the Committee

nodes.message: Hello. I saw your profile on Ring of Keys and wanted to discuss working together on a project.

Aislinn! Congratulations on becoming the new Executive Director. What a wonderful way to end one year and begin a new!

I look forward to our finding ways to work together once you are settled in. We (CSA) did a workshop with ROK members earlier this year. 

I am so happy for you!

Cheers,
Stephanie Klapper

Dear Zaniba,

My name is Katja Zarolinski and I am a casting director at JZ Casting in NYC. My office is currently working on casting the Oregon Shakespeare Festival 2022 Season and have a project we were hoping you might be available for/interested in auditioning for. For more information, please email me at katja@jz-casting.com

Thank you!

Hello Nikomeh, 

I am a casting director at JZ Casting in NYC. I am curious about your interest/availability in auditioning for a project at the Oregon Shakespeare Festival. For more information, please email me at katja@jz-casting.com

Thank you!

Dear Bayla,

Greetings from Boston!

I recently asked Andrea Prestinario at Ring of Keys to recommend one of her members for a musical theater project. You were the first person she thought of! 

Here’s what I wrote:

"I’m looking for bookwriter/dramaturg who writes comedy, has a good sense of humor and disdain for political correctness, who is not afraid of shocking an audience or poking fun of lots of different types of people. Do any of your Keys come to mind?"

If that sounds like you :) and you think you might have 30-minutes to look over some of the show, I can send you some materials. Or if you prefer, we can set up a Zoom call first and I can fill you in on the project before sending anything.

In short, the musical is cast for 5F/2M. The three biggest roles are female identifying: a witch, a lawyer, and a dancer. There’s a body swap, a lovable Italian baritone, and a dog. The show also has a lesbian relationship. 

At this point, I’m interested in finding a collaborator who can provide a new perspective on the story, who may or may not become an actual member of the writing team. All the details of an arrangement would be negotiable.

I hope all is well in Oakland. I think of Oakland often because I teach at Berklee College of Music, and we are often confused with UC Berkeley. My wife and I have visited several times and love the area.

Please let me know what you think.

Kevin Bleau
Associate Professor, Berklee College of Music
Musical Theater Writer
  CORONA BROs
  Awaken Youth
  Roswitha
  If You Want My Body
  The Mission
kevinbleau.com
kevin.bleau@gmail.com

Hello!
I am Michael and am the ED of TOSOS, www.TOSOSnyc.org
We are NYC’s longest Producing LGBTQIA+ theater company. We have an upcoming production in January 2022. It is called, “The Last Mother in the House of Chavis". It is a 3 handler. I would love to have a chance to speak with you to see if you have any interest. The show opens. Jan 12th, 2022. So, tech would be Jan 7,8,9,10,11 ish. Thank you for your consideration.

Hello Kai, my name is Dr James Lovelock and I am a researcher at the University of Wolverhampton in the UK.  I'm currently writing a book on LGBTQ* characters and queer identities in musical theatre for Bloomsbury, and I wondered whether it might be possible to interview you over Zoom about your work on Interstate and your wider ambitions in the musical theatre industry.  I've already interviewed Kit, Melissa and Sushma if you want to check out my credentials with them!  I'd particularly love to chat with you as I completely fell in love with your portrayal of Dash in the online Interstate concert. Let me know if you are interested then I can e-mail you some further information.  Hope all is good with you, James

Jonathan Winn
Co-Artistic Director
Thrown Stone Theatre Company

Hi CJ,

Hi, David Simpatico here, playwright up in Rhinebeck NY, you can check me out at my webpage, https://davidsimpatico.com

I found your listing on the Ring of Keys platform.  I'm doing an online reading of my new play, EX-GAY BAR, a very dark comedy/drama about the gay conversion therapy industry. It will be on Zoom, rehearsing during the first week of June, presented by Dutchess County Pride for Gay Pride on June 5. It requires six actors playing multiple parts. One of the actors doubles as a lesbian bartender and a teen boy mid-transition. I thought a non-binary actor might be a good fit. If you are interested, I'd be happy to send you the script and chat online in Zoom. This is a non-union, non-paying gig, but a very exciting project taking its first baby steps. 

Thanks for your time, and please let me know that you have received this email. My email is davidsimpatico@gmail.com.

Yours truly,

David Simpatico

Hi Emily, I hope you're staying well. I'm a NYC based (currently quarantining in my hometown of Louisville, KY) actor, et al, creator and advocate. You can find out more about me and my work, see my resume, recent clips, etc. at www.marissaghavami.com. Hi there,
We are an LA based casting office working on a hybrid reality show, UNTITLED ADVENTURE SHOW,  for an undisclosed streaming service. (We can't say which one at this time, but you'll know it). 
We are currently searching for non-union talent, and specifically looking for transgender or non-binary actors for the role of DRAVEN. The role is written as 30s-40s, but we are open on the age. 
Details below. If you think you'd be interested in self taping for us, please respond and we'll send you the material. Our email is clarkgeiercasting@gmail.com
Actors do not need to be based in LA - but they must be in the US and American citizens or have a green card. They will be traveled and put up at the location in Napa Valley, CA. They will quarantine for two weeks there prior to the shoot.
Quarantine: Mid November for 2 weeks (over Thanksgiving)Shoot: Early December for approx 3 1/2 weeks
Rate: $4K a week for a 6 day work week. (plus 10% where applicable)
Roles:DRAVEN
Male, 30s-40s. Transgender and non-binary performers encouraged to submit. Though Draven appears to be in his 30s-40s, he has lived for thousands of years. Worldly and wise, this powerful mage comes from five generations of trusted advisors to the rulers of Sanctum. But with the death of King Magnus, tragic as it may be, a new world of possibilities has opened for the ambitious Draven. Though outwardly loyal to the cause of Sanctum, Draven privately harbors a forbidden secret. Often, his demeanor bares the telltale signs of such a dark obsession…lust for power, pride, and raging anger….Please submit all ethnicities and all abilities. Actors with improv skills are a plus. Mid-Atlantic or British Accent Required. LEAD

Let us know if you have any questions.
Thanks,Helen & Kendra

Rate: $4K a week for a 6 day work week. (plus 10% where applicable)
Roles:DRAVEN
Male, 30s-40s. Transgender and non-binary performers encouraged to submit. Though Draven appears to be in his 30s-40s, he has lived for thousands of years. Worldly and wise, this powerful mage comes from five generations of trusted advisors to the rulers of Sanctum. But with the death of King Magnus, tragic as it may be, a new world of possibilities has opened for the ambitious Draven. Though outwardly loyal to the cause of Sanctum, Draven privately harbors a forbidden secret. Often, his demeanor bares the telltale signs of such a dark obsession…lust for power, pride, and raging anger….Please submit all ethnicities and all abilities. Actors with improv skills are a plus. Mid-Atlantic or British Accent Required. LEAD

Let us know if you have any questions.
Thanks,Helen & Kendra

James
